channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: PNP chief invited to attend meeting pushing for revolutionary gov't
item.author: Ratziel San Juan
item.description: “I had no chance to study its contents and I am in no position to confirm its veracity or to attest to its credibility,” he said in a separate statement, referring to the invitation.

item.title: COVID-19 cases in Philippines breach 187,000 as death toll nears 3,000
item.author: Ratziel San Juan
item.description: (Updated 4:22 p.m.) Over 22.53 million cases of the coronavirus, including around 789,000 deaths, have been recorded globally according to the latest World Health Organization figures.

item.title: UN office seeks effective measures to protect rights workers in Philippines
item.author: Ratziel San Juan
item.description: "Effective measures must be taken to protect other at-risk human rights defenders and to halt and condemn incitement to hatred against them."

item.title: Online shoppers can now order Filipino flavors from new Philippine Harvest site
item.description: The Department of Tourism recently launched a stand-alone online platform Philippine Harvest e-commerce website to make Filipino flavors accessible to the public online amid the COVID-19 pandemic.

item.title: 'Igme' strengthens into tropical storm
item.author: Ratziel San Juan
item.description: The tropical depression is projected to exit the Philippine Area of Responsibility by early morning Sunday and is expected to intensify into a severe tropical storm within 24 hours.

item.title: Tropical Depression Igme enhances southwest monsoon, bring rains in Luzon
item.author: Ratziel San Juan
item.description: “Sa ngayon po ay hindi na directly nakakaapekto itong si bagyong Igme sa ating bansa, subalit pinapa-enhance nito slightly ang habagat or southwest monsoon."

item.title: ‘Fight vs COVID-19 starts at home’
item.description: Sen. Bong Go warned the public about being complacent against COVID-19 and advised everyone to remain vigilant despite recent developments in vaccine trials around the world. Philippine authorities also began relaxing some quarantine protocols, such as the recent shift to general community quarantine of many areas in the country, including Metro Manila.

item.title: Rainy weekend seen due to LPA
item.author: Helen Flores
item.description: More rains are expected over Northern and Central Luzon this weekend due to a low- pressure area, which was forecast to develop into a tropical depression last night or today.

item.title: Google provides P12.5 million for distance learning
item.author: Janvic Mateo
item.description: Technology giant Google will provide $250,000, or an estimated P12.5 million, to support the shift to distance learning in the Philippines.

item.title: Only 25 nurses applied for DOH emergency hiring program
item.author: Sheila Crisostomo
item.description: Health Secretary Francisco Duque III yesterday reiterated the call for nurses affected by the deployment ban to help in attending to COVID-19 patients on the local front, saying only 25 of them have signed up.
